ovdesc.p: This screen is used to store the contract information in the payments hub.
Routing & Settlement process can deals with two types of Contracts - Country Contract and Party Contract.
The Party contract is checked for the credit party in the payment.
In a Party Contract, the bank specifies on how the payment should
be routed and settled with the credit party.
The Country contract is checked for the destination country of the payment. In a Country Contract, the bank specifies
on how it wants to route and settle payments to be sent to a specific country.
Peeling Off order determines the order in which the entries within the table are prioritized.

desc.p: User ID of the record creator
Unique ID generated by the payments hub in order to identify each record in the application.
This field gives the party for which the PTY Contract is defined.
The PTY Contract party can be defined as a BIC in which case it can be specified as a BIC4, BIC6, BIC-8 or BIC-11.
The Party ID type for a BIC is B.

A Party ID Type and Party ID can therefore be defined for example as – B BARC, B BARCGB, B BARCGB21 or B BARCGB2106P. (An Contract with a BIC-11 has a higher priority compared to an Contract defined at BIC-8. Similarly in terms of pririty - BIC-8 Contract > BIC-6 Contract > BIC-4 Contract)
The Party ID can also be defined as a National Clearing Code (NCC). The Party ID type for a national clearing is N. A Party ID Type and Party ID can therefore be defined for example as - N SC200050
This field is applicable only for the Party Contract.
The Party ID type for a BIC is B.
The Party ID type for a national clearing is N.
Record Activation Code generated for the record by the payment's hub.
Possible values:
N - Not active
A - Active
H - History
F - Future
C - Not active future
When specified, the Routing Product can be used to define Product specific
routing mechanisms.
Routing Product is set as per the Product determination step of STP process flow.
Record Status Code generated for the record by the payments hub.
Possible values:
L - Live
U - Unapproved
R - Reversed
Specifies the date from which the record is to be considered as active for payments processing.
Date and Time when the record was approved in DD MON 2015 HH:MM:SS.MMM format
User ID of the record approver
Every company has a number of business lines.
Country and Party contracts can be made specific to a business line.
Indicates the company ID for which the record is created.
The value links to the field ‘CompanyID’ in PPT.COMPANY
The Contract for which the Contract Categories are defined.
Contracts can be defined for a credit party of a payment or for the destination country of a payment.
A Contract defined for the credit party is called as a PTY Contract and a Contract defined for the destination country is called as a CTY Contract.
Destination Country Code to which the payment needs to be routed.
Specifies the date until which the record is to be considered as active for payments processing.Post this date, the record will be set as Inactive by the payments hub.
Date and Time when the record was created in DD MON 2015 HH:MM:SS.MMM format
